page.title: 06 Traditions
page.content: One Whitstable tradition is the{May {Day Festival}at the Castle. The Endowed School takes part in the dancing and there are Morris Dancers with Jack o' the Green. Every August we hold a{Regatta}and a {Carnival. On November 5th the town holds a number of public firework displays. { "The Blessing of the Water"}takes place at Reeves Beach during August. The lifeboats and the Sea Cadets gather off the shore while a local clergyman conducts a service of thanksgiving. There is also a{"Whitstable Oyster {Festival"}which takes place in August when Grotters are built from oyster shells and lit with candles.Every year the Round Table holds a Donkey Derby. Also there is a barge race along the Thames Estuary each summer.
